The Regular Board Meeting will begin at 4:00 p.m. in the Board Room of the Education Center.   Anyone wishing to address the Board regarding Closed Session items may speak at this time.  The Board will then adjourn to Closed Session in the Superintendent’s Conference Room.
	 
	 
Board President Eddie Garcia intends to participate in this Regular Board Meeting by teleconference from the following location, which shall be freely accessible to the public during the teleconference:
	 
3211 Stimson Way
San Jose, CA  95135

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.03
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent, Manny Barbara, Vice President of Silicon Valley Education Foundation, and Rosa De Leon, Californians for Justice 
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-14 College and Career Readiness for All
	 
For the past year, the district, through the Board, teachers, staff, students and community, has been discussing the student achievement gap and over all student achievement.  While the district continues to make progress on the Academic Performance Index (API), a high stakes state measurement tool, the achievement gap continues among our Latino students and African American students when compared to other ethnic groups.  More recently, the discussion has focused on how students can be both college and career ready.  The accepted definition of "college ready" is successful completion of the UC/CSU "a-g" requirements.  Alternatively, the accepted definition of "career ready" is the successful completion of a career technical education sequence.  The attached resolution proposes to make "a-g" college requirements as the default placement for 9th and 10th grade students unless otherwise stated in an Individualized Education Plan.  The resolution also memorializes the district's commitment to providing a rigorous academic curriculum and support that prepares students for postsecondary educational and career options.
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2010/2011-14 College and Career Readiness for All.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2010/2011-14 College and Career Readiness for All.
items.item_text: Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-14 College Career Readiness for All - Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent, Manny Barbara, Vice President of Silicon Valley Education Foundation, and Rosa De Leon, Californians for Justice
items.item_text_raw: 9.03 Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-14 College Career Readiness for All - Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent, Manny Barbara, Vice President of Silicon Valley Education Foundation, and Rosa De Leon, Californians for Justice

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.04
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Receive and Adopt Amended Board By Law #9270 Conflict of Interest; Revolving Door Policy and #9270 Appendix A Designated Positions/Disclosure Categories
	 
	 
Pursuant to the Government Code, the District is required to adopt a conflict of interest code.  The District's conflict of interest code is contained in Board By Law 9270.  Most recently, the Board approved revisions in Board By Law 9270 in September 2010.  The Government Code and the Rules and Regulations adopted by the Fair Political Practices Commission require the District to designate positions which are required to submit disclosures of financial interests, and to update the titles of positions when new positions are created, when position titles are changed, or when positions or position duties are revised or modified to fall within the disclosure categories.  The changes reflected in the attached draft proposed revised Board By Law 9270 and Appendix A clarify new or existing positions to be included within the category of positions required to submit disclosures and add some new clarifyng language.  The District must submit the proposed approved changes to the Santa Clara County Counsel by October 22, 2010.
	 
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
RECOMMENDATION:
Approve amended Board By Law 9270 and Appendix A thereto as presented.
items.item_text: Receive and Adopt Amended Board By Law #9270 Conflict of Interest; Revolving Door Policy and #9270 Appendix A Designated Positions/Disclosure Categories â Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
items.item_text_raw: 9.04 Receive and Adopt Amended Board By Law #9270 Conflict of Interest; Revolving Door Policy and #9270 Appendix A Designated Positions/Disclosure Categories â Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.05
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve Extension of Exclusive Right to Negotiate Agreement
	 
	 
On July 28, 2010, the Board approved an Exclusive Right to Negotiate Agreement between the District and Santa Clara Development Company ("SCDC") for a period of 90 days to negotiate a possible exchange agreement with the District for an approximate 7.5 acre portion of the District Office property at 830 N. Capitol Avenue for other real property still to be designated by the District.  (A copy of that agreement approved by the Board is attached.)  SCDC has provided a draft agreement and discussions regarding the scope and terms of the agreement are underway.  Administration recommends extending the term of the Exclusive Right to Negotiate Agreement for 120 days to allow additional time for the parties to consider and review the terms of a proposed exchange agreement.  Any exchange agreement will have to be reviewed and approved by the Board in public session at a Board meeting.
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
None
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
RECOMMENDATION:
Approve extension of Right to Negotiate Agreement between the District and Santa Clara Development Company for 120 days and authorize and direct Superintendent to enter into extension agreement.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.01
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Kirsten King, Director of Instructional Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Summary Presentation on the Report of Student Achievement 2009-2010 and Program Improvement 
	 
DESCRIPTION:
	 
The California STAR accountability program is in the twelfth year of administration.  East Side Union High School District students in grades 9 -11 took the State mandated California Standards Tests (CST) and the California High School Exit Exam.  Together these assessments make up the elements of the Acountability Reporting System:  Academic Performance Index (API), Adequate Yearly Progress (AYP), and Program Improvement (PI).  This report contains information on how students and subgroups of students performed on these tests.
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
N/A
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
N/A
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept the above report.
items.item_text: Summary Presentation on the Report of Student Achievement 2009-2010 and Program Improvement - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Kirsten King, Director of Instructional Services
items.item_text_raw: 10.01 Summary Presentation on the Report of Student Achievement 2009-2010 and Program Improvement - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Kirsten King, Director of Instructional Services

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.02
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Carole Hersom, Coordinator of Special Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Special Services Presentation
	 
Special Services is responsible for a multitude of services being provided to the students of East Side Union High School District.  The major responsibility of the department is providing instructional services to students who qualify under the thirteen categories of Special Education.  The majority of students are served in Special Day Class (SDC) and Resource Specialist Program (RSP) classes offered at all twelve school sites.  Specialized programs exist throughout the district to serve students with the following identified disabilities:  Autism (SDC-AUT), Mental Retardation (SDC-LF) and Emotional Distrubances (ED).  Additionally, we have a Post Senior Program, located on Yerba Buena's campus which continues to meet the educational, vocational and transitional needs of our LF and AUT populations until the age of 22. (A list of schools and locations of specialized programs will be presented.)
	 
Any service a student receives is detailed on a yearly developed Individual Education Plan (IEP).  Again, the primary focus is educational but may include other services needed to assist the student in a accessing curriculum.  Some examples of additional services are:  speech/language therapy, occupational therapy, individual/group counseling services, 1:1 paraeducator assistance and transportation.  We have four Program Specialists, who attend IEP meetings and determine what additional services are needed to help students be successful.
	 
Situations do arise when we are unable to meet a student's educational needs at one of our comprehensive campuses.  At this point, placement must be considered at a Non Public School (NPS) to properly serve the student.  A program specialist, after consulation with the department coordinator, is involved in this meeting and decision making process.  (Here I will have a list of nonpublic schools and approximate yearly cost for the students attending for the 2009-10 school year.)
	 
With the joint collaboration of the Transportation and Special Services Departments, transportaton services have been tremendously improved.  Other challenges facing Special Services include:  Program Improvement (PI) involvement, professional development for all staff at all sites, California State Department compliance issues and the resulting costs associated with these issues.
	 
Additional services provided and overseen by Special Services are:
	 
Transitional Services
WorkAbility 1
Extended School Year (ESY)
Initial Evaluations
Student Study Teams (SST)
Home/Hospital Instruction
Section 504 Plans
items.item_text: Special Services Presentation - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Carole Hersom, Coordinator of Special Services
items.item_text_raw: 10.02 Special Services Presentation - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Carole Hersom, Coordinator of Special Services

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.03
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Robert Ibarra, Coordinator of Professional Development/Migrant Education
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Receive the Third Valenzuela/CAHSEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint Quarterly Report for Period Covering July 1, 2010  through September 30, 2010 as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727)
	 
BACKGROUND
As a result of the Williams Case (EC 35186), referred to as a landmark Superior Court case requires that every California public school provide each student with, at the very least, sufficient textbooks and instructional materials; clean, safe and functional buildings and facilities; and permanent, appropriately trained and assigned teachers.  Additionally, under the settlement of the Valenzuela/CAHSEE Settlement (EC 37254) students in grades 10 to 12 inclusive shall be notified of services available to students up to two consecutive years after the completion of grade 12 who have not yet passed the CAHSEE.
	 
School districts shall support summarized data on the nature and resolution of all Williams Complaints and Valenzuela/CAHSEE Complaints on a quarterly basis to the governing board and the county superintendent of schools.  The report shall include the number of complaints by general subject area with the number of resolved and unresolved complaints.
	 
The attached report indicates the number of complaints filed from July 1, 2010 through September 30, 2010.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Senate Bill 6 (Williams)
State Instructional Materials Allocation
District Instructional Materials Budget
Other Categorical Funds as Appropriate
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
None
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
The administration recommends that the Governing Board accept the Third Quarterly Valenzuela/CAHSEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint Report for the period covering July 1, 2010 through September 30, 2010, as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727).

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  12.02
	 
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
	 
PREPARED BY:            Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
	 
SUBJECT:                    Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:30 p.m.
                                    Regarding Tentative Successor Agreement with the San Jose, Federation of 
                                    Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO, July 1, 2010 – June 30, 20111, and
                                    Disclosure of Major Provisions of Tentative Agreement (AB1200) 
	 
	 
In accordance with Assembly Bill 1200 requiring school districts to disclose, at a public meeting, the cost that would be incurred by the implementation of a collective bargaining agreement.  In meeting the requirement, a public hearing is being held to give our community an opportunity to comment on the cost of this tentative agreement.
	 
Attached is a copy of the proposed changes to the collective bargaining agreement with the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO.  The District and the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO reached a tentative agreement on August 30, 2010.  The tentative agreement was ratified by San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO on September 16, 2010.
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Administration recommends that the Board accept any comment on the proposed Tentative Agreement with the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO, July 1, 2010 – June 30, 2011.
items.item_text: Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:30 p.m. Regarding Proposed Tentative Agreement with the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO, July 1, 2010 – June 30, 2011, and Disclosure of Major Provisions of Tentative Agreement (AB1200) - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
items.item_text_raw: 12.02 Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:30 p.m. Regarding Proposed Tentative Agreement with the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO, July 1, 2010 – June 30, 2011, and Disclosure of Major Provisions of Tentative Agreement (AB1200) - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  12.03
	 
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
	 
PREPARED BY:            Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
	 
SUBJECT:                    Ratify and Approve Tentative Successor Agreement with the San Jose, Federation of 
                                    Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO, July 1, 2010 – June 30, 2011 
	 
Attached is a copy of the proposed changes to the collective bargaining agreement with the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO.  The District and the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO reached a tentative agreement on August 30, 2010.  The tentative agreement was ratified by San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO on September 16, 2010.  We are submitting this agreement to the Board of Trustees for approval.
	 
In addition, provisions of AB1200 require that the school districts disclose, at a public meeting, the cost that would be incurred by the implementation of a collective bargaining agreement.  In meeting the requirement, a public hearing was held to give our community an opportunity to comment on the cost of this tentative Agreement
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
As per the attached AB1200 document
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Adult Education funds
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees, per compliance with AB1200, ratify and approve the tentative agreement between the East Side Union High School District and the San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO.
items.item_text: Ratify and Approve Tentative Successor Agreement with San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO, July 1, 2010 - June 30, 2011 - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
items.item_text_raw: 12.03 Ratify and Approve Tentative Successor Agreement with San Jose Federation of Teachers, AFT Local 957, AFL-CIO, July 1, 2010 - June 30, 2011 - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  12.04
	 
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
	 
PREPARED BY:            Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
	 
SUBJECT:                    Approve the Classified Management Title and Job Description 
                                    Director, Information Technology
	 
	 
The job description for Director, Information Technology will replace the job description of Data Processing Manager.
	 
This position is under the supervision of the Associate Superintendent, Business Services.  It provides the overall leadership for technology and technology-based information planning, administers the activities of the Information Services Department and ensures that technology enables the effective delivery of quality educational and administrative services for students, parents and community in order to positively impact student achievement.  
	 
This position is a 12 month Classified Management position at an annual salary range of $109,659.00 - $117,253.00 per year.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$109,659.00 - $117,253.00 per year
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the classified management title and job description for Director, Information Technology.
items.item_text: Approve the Classified Management Title and Job Description Director, Information Technology - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
items.item_text_raw: 12.04 Approve the Classified Management Title and Job Description Director, Information Technology - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  12.05
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent, and Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent of Human Resources and Instruction
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-16 Accepting Donation to District to Fund Counselor Position for Up to Four Years
	 
	 
	 
A person who desires to remain anonymous has indicated their intent to donate sufficient monies to fund a counselor position at Piedmont Hills High School for up to four school years (2010/2011 - 2013/2014) and upon the condition that the monies be used solely to fund an added counselor position at Piedmont Hills High School for the donation period.  The donation would be made by donor to a third party non-profit organization (yet to be determined) which organization would, in turn, disburse the monies directly to the District each year upon certification by the District that the monies will be used exclusively to fund the counselor position at Piedmont Hills High School.
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Approximately $404,171 in funds over 4 school years; funds to be restricted in use
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
RECOMMENDATION:
Administration recommends the Board adopt Resolution #2010/2011-16 accepting the gift on the conditions specified therein and authorizing Administration to enter into a Fiscal Agent Services Agreement with a third party non-profit organization for the administration and disbursement of the gift to the District.
items.item_recommendation: Administration recommends the Board adopt Resolution #2010/2011-16 accepting the gift on the conditions specified therein and authorizing Administration to enter into a Fiscal Agent Services Agreement with a third party non-profit organization for the administration and disbursement of the gift to the District.

meeting_sections.section_name: HUMAN RESOURCES - OPERATIONAL ITEMS/BOARD DISCUSSION AND/OR ACTION

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  13.01
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-15 Authorizing and Approving the Borrowing of Funds for Fiscal Year 2010-11; the Issuance and Sale of a 2010-11 Tax and Revenue Anticipation Note (TRANS)
	 
Tax Revenue Anticipation Notes (TRANS) are short term financing that is sold on the Municipal Bond Market for public agency cash flow needs.  School Districts have historically utilized this as the least expensive way to handle low cash needs prior to receipt of major tax revenues.  East Side Union High School District in last couple of years has utilized available cash balances in other funds to cover this need because the low interest earnings on cash balances has not made it reasonable to cover the cost of issuing such notes.  Because of the volatility of the State of California economy and the State deferring apportionments to school districts this may be the least costly method to manage low cash flow periods.  The resolution would give the District the option of issuing TRANS in an amount not to exceed $12 million.  The District in the past had issued TRANS as a sole issuer; however this issue would be pooled with other school districts that are currently issuing TRANS also.  The cost of issuance to the District is estimated to be:
	 
Bond/Disclosure Counsel
8,000.00
Financial Advisor
5,000.00
Underwriter
6,000.00
OS/POS Printing/Posting & Distribution     
1,764.71
Demographics
-
Rating Moody's
4,900.00
Trustee
480.00
Total
26,144.71
	 
The Business Office is also exploring an alternative cash flow financing that may exclude the cost of a rating service.  The TRANS authorization and previous authorizations by the Board will give options for managing cash flow needs to meet operational cost during the year in anticipation that the State continues deferring of apportionments.
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$26,144.71
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution #2010/2011-15 Authorizing the District to issue Tax Revenue Anticipation Notes in the amount of $12,000,000.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution #2010/2011-15 authorizing the District to issue Tax Revenue Anticipation Notes in the amount of $12,000,000.
items.item_text: Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-15 Authorizing and Approving the Borrowing of Funds for Fiscal Year 2010-11; the Issuance and Sale of a 2010-11 Tax and Revenue Anticipation Note (TRANS) - Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  13.03
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve Authorization to Expand the District's Usage of Recycled Water for Exterior Grounds Irrigation
	 
Currently the District utilizes recycled water for grounds irrigation at Silver Creek, Andrew Hill and Evergreen Valley High Schools.  The San Jose Water Company (SJWC) is offering an opportunity to save money on our water bill by using recycled water. Using recycled water instead of drinking water for landscape irrigation will reduce our water rate by 25%.  SJWC will provide at no cost design and construction services to connect District sites to recycled water. 
	 
The SJWC is currently offering to do this at Yerba Buena High School.  We are requesting the authorization to enter into an agreement for Right of Entry and Construction Agreement for the San Jose Water Company Recycled Water Retrofit specifically for Yerba Buena High School and any future expansion of such retrofits at other District sites.  For future site expansions it is understood that the Board will be informed of such activity before an agreement is executed.
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve authorization to enter into an agreement for Right of Entry and Construction Agreement for the San Jose Water Company Recycled Water Retrofit specifically for Yerba Buena High School and any future expansion of such retrofits at other District sites.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve authorization to enter into an agreement for Right of Entry and Construction Agreement for the San Jose Water Company Recycled Water Retrofit specifically for Yerba Buena High School and any future expansion of such retrofits at other District sites.

Item:  13.04
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve Staff Member Reimbursement for Direct Purchase of Equipment
	 
Board Policy and Administration Regulations effective November 2009 prohibit staff from directly purchasing equipment thus circumventing purchasing procedures, receiving and inventory controls.  Mr. Dan Johnson, teacher at Evergreen Valley high School states he was not aware of regulation restrictions and purchased Sanyo Brand, Elmo Model TT02Rx classroom presenter & projector camera on May 25, 2010, in the amount of $1,190.00.  The projection camera is in use in the classroom for educational instruction.  The Administrative Regulation does not provide for any Administrator to authorize reimbursement for such purchase.
	 
Upon Approval of the Baord for reimbursement to Mr. Johnson the equipment will be tagged as property of the East Side Union High School District and placed in inventory control.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$1,190.00
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Site Department Budget
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the reimbursement to Mr. Dan Johnson for the purchase of classroom equipment.

meeting_sections.section_name: BUSINESS SERVICES - OPERATIONAL ITEMS/BOARD DISCUSSION AND/OR ACTION

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
		 
Item:  14.01
		 
		 
		 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent Administration and Business Services and June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Approval for Use of Proposed Bond Measure E Logo Design
		 
		 
The voters in the East Side Union High School District approved the Measure E Bond General Obligation Bond in February 2008.  The first funds for Measure E were sold in May of 2008.
		 
As the implementation of the Measure E Bond Program continues, the Measure E Bond program team held a logo design contest for the East Side Union High School District's Art students.  The purpose of the contest was to create a logo that is easily identifiable with the Measure E Bond Program construction projects.
		 
The winning logo concept may be used on the Measure E Bond website as well as brochures and other informational materials.  This was a wonderful opportunity to assist in the branding of Measure E with the added benefit of involving students in the process.  The number of entries was more than expected, with 128 students submitting entries for a total of approximately 200 logo design concepts.
		 
This effort has allowed the District team to continue creating opportunities of involving students in the Bond program as well as giving them additional information with how this program can create better classrooms and school environment for them.
		 
		 
		 
		 
		 
FISCAL IMPACT:
N/A
		 
FUNDING SOURCE:
N/A
		 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the use of the winning Measure E logo design concept as part of our Bond program implementation.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the use of the winning Measure E logo design concept as part of our Bond program implementation.
items.item_text: Approval for Use of Proposed Bond Measure E Logo Design - Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services and June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  15.06
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve Award of Bid for District-Wide Printers, Document Cameras and LCD Projectors (RFB-01-10-11)
	 
The attached Award of Bid for District-Wide Printers, Document Cameras and LCD projectors is presented for review and approval.  
	 
The RFP was sent out to eight (8) known vendors and was available on the East Side Union High School District’s website.  The District received eleven (11) proposals.  
	 
The evaluation process consisted of reviewing pricing and exceptions and compliance with specifications for each bid.
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$750,000
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Measure E; Various Funding
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the attached Award of Bid for District-Wide Printers, Document Cameras and LCD projectors as indicated in the recommendations.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
	 
Item:  15.07
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Accept Warrant Register for the Month of September 2010
	 
Attached is a list of warrants issued during the month of September 2010, in response to board Policy 3314 Payment for Goods and Services adopted by the board in May 2009.  The Policy states that, “The Board shall approve all warrants (checks) at a regularly scheduled Board meeting.”  While there is no legal requirement for Board approval of issued warrants, this list and future lists will add to the “transparency” of when the Board approves purchase orders, contracts and other authorized expenses as per Board Policies.
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept the warrant register for the month of September 2010.
